rdtn_force

exct_force

Compute total excitation force at time t

API

source.hydrodynamic_forces.rdtn_force(t: float, dT: float, Trdtn: numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.float64], IRF: numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.float64], t_vel_history: numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.float64]) → numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.float64][source]
source.hydrodynamic_forces.exct_force(WvHeadingIdx: int, omega_i: numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.float64], omega: numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.float64], phase_rand: numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.float64], spectrum: numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.float64], Fex: numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.complex128], exctnTime: numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.complex128]) → numpy.typing.NDArray[numpy.float64][source]

Compute total excitation force at time t

The excitation force doesn’t consider vessel dispalcement and only considers wave height. The formula for the force follows reference format from Wamit Manual. The wave height calculated based on Tabesphour (2023).

Input

WvHeadingIdx: Correspond to the index of wave heading of Fex.

omega_i: Angular frequencies from Wamit file, (float N_omega_i) (rad/s)

omega: Angular frequencies to be evaluated, (float N_omega) (rad/s)

phase_rand: random phase for each corresponding omega, (float N_omega) (rad/s)

spectrum: Wave spectrum, (float N_omega) (m^2 s)

Fex: Complex hydrodynamic excitation coefficient, (float N_omega_i) (N/m)

exctnTime: Time at which exciation time is calculated,(float N_exctnTime) (s)
